title: How to Clear Your Browser Search History on iPhone, Android, Mac & PC

steps.title: Enter the search you want to delete into your web browser's address bar.
steps.content: Enter the search you want to delete into your web browser's address bar. This only works on desktops, but since many browsers sync, the same searches should disappear from your smartphone and tablet. This works for many web browsers, like Chrome and Firefox, to delete embarrassing search terms or phrases. It doesn't delete your browser history, however. Oppido notes that whether you should clear your browsing data comes down to personal preference. "If it's my own computer, I just think of it as my footprint," he says. "Now, if I'm on my parents' computer, a friend's computer, or a library computer, I will delete my history when I'm done because I don't want anybody to see what I've been doing."

steps.title: Highlight the term or phrase you want to delete.
steps.content: Highlight the term or phrase you want to delete. Use the arrow keys on the right side of your keyboard to highlight the term or phrase that you want to delete; don't press Enter or click the item to search. You'll know if the search term or phrase is something from your history if you see a clock with an arrow around it. You'll also see icons for pages you've visited in the past and suggestions from your preferred search engine, like Google or Bing.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+Del.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + Del . The Shift key is on the left side of your keyboard and the Del button is on the right; pressing these two together will delete the search term or phrase. If you type the beginning letters of that search term or phrase, it will no longer auto-complete or appear as a suggestion. Continue using the methods below if you want to delete your entire search history on different devices.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Tap the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Tap … .
steps.content: Tap … . It's in the top-right corner of the screen if you're using an iPad and in the bottom if you're using an iPhone. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . This is in the row of buttons at the top of the drop-down menu. Scroll to the side until you find History , then tap it. Doing so opens your iPhone's Chrome history page.

steps.title: Tap Delete Browsing Data….
steps.content: Tap Delete Browsing Data… . You'll find it in the lower-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Autofill Data.
steps.content: Tap Autofill Data . It's at the bottom of the menu. Doing so will place a checkmark next to Autofill Data . If Autofill Data already has a checkmark next to it, skip this step. You can uncheck every other item on the page, but the Autofill Data option must be checked.

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data.
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data . This option is at the bottom of the page. Tap Delete browsing data when prompted. Doing so will clear your search box data for Google Chrome on your iPhone. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Tap the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . This option is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data….
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data… . It's at the top of the History page.

steps.title: Check the "Autofill form data" box.
steps.content: Check the "Autofill form data" box. It's in the middle of the screen. You can uncheck every other, but the "Autofill form data" box must be checked in order to clear the search box contents. If the "Autofill form data" box is already checked, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap the time range drop-down box.
steps.content: Tap the time range drop-down box. You'll find this on the upper-right side of the page across from the "Time range" header. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap All time.
steps.content: Tap All time . It's in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Delete data.
steps.content: Tap Delete data . This is at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Delete when prompted.
steps.content: Tap Delete when prompted. Doing so clears all of your search box data for Google Chrome on your Android.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Click or double-click the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the Chrome window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Delete browsing data….
steps.content: Click Delete browsing data… . Alternatively, press Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + Del .

steps.title: Click the Advanced tab.
steps.content: Click the Advanced tab. This is in the top-right corner of the pop-up window.

steps.title: Scroll down and check the "Autofill form data" box.
steps.content: Scroll down and check the "Autofill form data" box. It's near the bottom of the pop-up window. You can uncheck every other box on the Advanced tab, but the "Autofill form data" box must be checked in order to clear the search box contents. If the "Autofill form data" box is already checked, skip this step.

steps.title: Click the "Time range" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Time range" drop-down box. This is at the top of the pop-up window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click All time.
steps.content: Click All time . It's in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Delete data.
steps.content: Click Delete data . This blue button is at the bottom of the window. Doing so clears your search box data for Google Chrome on your computer.

steps.title: Navigate to Safari in Settings.
steps.content: Navigate to Safari in Settings. Tap the app icon that looks like a gear to open Settings, then tap Apps to see a list of all the apps installed on the device.

steps.title: Tap Clear history and Website Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear history and Website Data . While this doesn't affect your autofill saved settings (like usernames and passwords), it will delete your browsing data; the next time you type into a search bar, it doesn't fill with other terms or phrases you've searched. [2] X Research source If you want to delete your Autofill information, follow the steps to do this on a Mac.

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . It's in the menu bar at the top of your screen when you have Safari open.

steps.title: Click Clear History and choose the time range.
steps.content: Click Clear History and choose the time range. If you have Safari synced across devices, clearing your history this way will delete the history for every device. Click Clear History to finish the process.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings . Click Safari from the menu bar at the top of your screen and select Settings .

steps.title: Click the AutoFill tab.
steps.content: Click the AutoFill tab. You'll see this at the top of the "Settings" window as a tab. This will show you a list of AutoFill options.

steps.title: Uncheck the box next to the autofill item.
steps.content: Uncheck the box next to the autofill item. Click Edit if you want to edit the autofill entry, but unchecking the box next to each item will prevent autofill from working with that type of information. For example, if you uncheck the box next to "Other forms," Safari should no longer store and autofill information that you enter into search engines. You can also click Edit next to "Other forms" and remove entries for individual sites (such as Google).

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Tap the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox on a blue globe.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. A pop-up menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This option is in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Data Management.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Data Management . You'll find it near the middle of the page under the "Privacy" header.

steps.title: Tap the white "Browsing History" switch .
steps.content: Tap the white "Browsing History" switch . Doing so turns on the switch, thus indicating that you want to clear your Firefox browsing history. You can turn off every other switch on this page. Unfortunately, Firefox for the iPhone doesn't include an "Autofill" option, so you'll have to clear your whole browser's history in order to clear the search box contents. If the "Browsing History" switch is blue, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Clear Private Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Private Data . It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap OK when prompted.
steps.content: Tap OK when prompted. Doing so will clear your iPhone's Firefox search box history.

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Tap the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox on a blue globe.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This option is in the middle of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Clear private data.
steps.content: Tap Clear private data . You'll find this in the middle of the screen.

steps.title: Check the "Form history" box.
steps.content: Check the "Form history" box. Doing so indicates that you want to clear your Firefox search box history. If this box is already checked, skip this step. You can uncheck every other box on this page, but the "Form history" box must be checked.

steps.title: Tap CLEAR DATA.
steps.content: Tap CLEAR DATA . It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will clear your Android's Firefox search box history.

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox. Click or double-click the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox on a blue globe.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the Firefox window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . It's in the second grouping of menu options with Bookmarks .

steps.title: Click Clear Recent History….
steps.content: Click Clear Recent History… . This is near the top of the menu. Doing so opens a pop-up window.

steps.title: Click the "When" drop-down box and select Everything.
steps.content: Click the "When" drop-down box and select Everything . You'll see a warning that all your history and everything you have selected will be deleted.

steps.title: Check the box next to History.
steps.content: Check the box next to History . You can uncheck the other boxes, but this one must be checked to delete your autofill history.

steps.title: Click Clear.
steps.content: Click Clear . Your history and autofill history will be deleted from Firefox. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. Click or double-click the Microsoft Edge app icon, which is either a dark-blue "e" or a white "e" on a dark-blue background. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you want to clear the autofill history on your other synced devices, like your smartphone or tablet, leave sync on in your profile settings. However, if you don't want to delete the autofill on other devices, turn off sync as you follow these steps.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . According to Computer & Tech Specialist Luigi Oppido, you'll find the option to clear your browsing history here. Clearing your browsing history includes your autofill data, which includes information you've typed into search boxes on sites. It's in the top-right corner of the Edge window. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This option is near the bottom of the drop-down menu and will load the "Settings" page.

steps.title: Click Privacy, search, and services.
steps.content: Click Privacy, search, and services . It's in the menu on the left-side panel.

steps.title: Click Choose what to clear.
steps.content: Click Choose what to clear . It's towards the middle of the page, under the "Delete browsing data" header.

steps.title: Check the "Autofill form data" box.
steps.content: Check the "Autofill form data" box. This option is in the middle of the menu and lets you know that examples of "Autofill form data" include forms and cards. You can uncheck every other box here, but the "Autofill form data" box must be checked. If this box is already checked, skip this step.

steps.title: Click Clear now.
steps.content: Click Clear now . It's at the bottom of the menu.
